channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Unusable pavement along this road, 14th October
item.description:
The section of pavement from Staverton Bridge all the way to the left turn to take you to Hazlewoods. This section of pavement is largely unusable in its current state and is becoming dangerous to be on. The pavement is covered in branches, overgrown grass and even a section of sand on one part making it difficult to traverse. Many people, including myself, use it to cycle on due to the dangers presented by the fast road however, recently it is not possible, with some people even coming off their bikes due to obstructions and sections of the pavement having worn away etc. The grass growing over from the field next to it adds to the difficulty. Would it be at all possible to have this section cleared so that the section to walk/cycle on is a bit wider so it’s not as dangerous? At the moment it results in you being uncomfortably close to the road. I appreciate it’s not a highly used section but as quite a few people use it to get to work it would be helpful if it was in better condition.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 14th October
item.description:
There are more potholes but my GPS signal was bad so couldn't get the words. But you get the gist.... the whole of this road is full of potholes and getting worse with the increased traffic.

item.title: Fly tipping of cardboard and branches, 14th October
item.description:
Please can you collect the cardboard and tree branches that have been dumped on princess Elizabeth Way, in the lay by near Lechmere road junction. Not sure how long its been there, I only just saw it this morning. Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Quebec Drive, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branch now hanging precariously & will probably fall when windy conditions return., 14th October
item.description:
Already reported ref: 11495886 (web ref: HCF004949). The damaged branch is very long & quite high plus it straddles two pathways.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44, Cleevelands Avenue, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
